issue.title: [C++][Gandiva] Add round functions for decimals
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5451](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5451). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Will use this Jira to add support for :
 \* round
 \* truncate
 \* ceil
 \* floor
 \* cast decimal to double, double to decimal
 \* cast decimal to long, long to decimal
 \* convert (modify precision/scale)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5451?focusedCommentId=16861889) by Pindikura Ravindra (pravindra):*
Issue resolved by pull request 4418

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5451?focusedCommentId=16888376) by Sidharth Kapur (sid-kap):*
`[~pravindra]` Does this change mean that in newer releases of pyarrow, it will be possible to cast decimal types to floats? i.e., will it fix the following issue:

`ArrowNotImplementedError: No cast implemented from decimal(28, 6) to double`

?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5451?focusedCommentId=16888378) by Sidharth Kapur (sid-kap):*
Oh, never mind, I think this change only applies to Gandiva, not to the base PyArrow library?
